what: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa
title: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa
text: https://pakillo.github.io/DHARMa.helpers DHARMa.helpers R package facilitates checking fitted statistical models via DHARMa package. now, Bayesian models fitted brms implemented. See blogpost detailed explanation approach.

title: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa
Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa
Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa
text: Fit model: Check DHARMa:  Note use integer = TRUE case modelling discrete response (counts). Now check residuals predictor (zAge):  Test overdispersion:  See https://pakillo.github.io/DHARMa.helpers/reference/dh_check_brms.html examples.
code: # Example model taken brms::brm() # Poisson regression for the number of seizures in epileptic patients fit1 <- brm(count ~ zAge + zBase * Trt + (1|patient),             data = epilepsy, family = poisson(), refresh = 0) #> Compiling Stan program... #> Start sampling simres <- dh_check_brms(fit1, integer = TRUE) plot(simres, form = epilepsy$zAge) DHARMa::testDispersion(simres) #>  #>  DHARMa nonparametric dispersion test via sd of residuals fitted vs. #>  simulated #>  #> data:  simulationOutput #> dispersion = 1.1747, p-value = 0.194 #> alternative hypothesis: two.sided

what: DHARMa.helpers: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa — DHARMa.helpers-package
title: DHARMa.helpers: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa — DHARMa.helpers-package
text: Helper functions check models (yet) directly supported DHARMa package, Bayesian models fitted brms, exponential random graph models (ERGMs).

title: DHARMa.helpers: Helper functions to check models not (yet) directly supported by DHARMa — DHARMa.helpers-package

what: Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
title: Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
code: dh_check_brms(   model,   resp = NULL,   integer = FALSE,   plot = TRUE,   nsamples = 1000,   ntrys = 5,   ... )

title: Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
text: model fitted model brms::brmsfit-class(). Categorical ordinal models supported now. resp Optional name response variable (multivariate models). integer Logical (TRUE/FALSE), indicating response integer, Poisson binomial models plot Logical. Plot residual checks? Default TRUE. nsamples Integer. Number samples draw posterior. ntrys Integer. Number trys use truncated distributions. See brms::posterior_predict(). ... arguments DHARMa::plotResiduals()

title: Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
text: object type DHARMa. See DHARMa::createDHARMa() details.

title: Check Bayesian models fitted with brms — dh_check_brms
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive()  #' # Example models taken from brms::brm()  # Poisson regression for the number of seizures in epileptic patients fit1 <- brm(count ~ zAge + zBase * Trt + (1|patient),            data = epilepsy, family = poisson()) simres <- dh_check_brms(fit1, integer = TRUE) plot(simres, form = epilepsy$zAge) testDispersion(simres)   # Probit regression using the binomial family ntrials <- sample(1:10, 100, TRUE) success <- rbinom(100, size = ntrials, prob = 0.4) x <- rnorm(100) data4 <- data.frame(ntrials, success, x) fit4 <- brm(success | trials(ntrials) ~ x, data = data4,             family = binomial("probit")) summary(fit4) simres <- dh_check_brms(fit4, integer = TRUE) plot(simres, form = data4$x)   # Multivariate (multiresponse) model data("BTdata", package = "MCMCglmm") bf_tarsus <- bf(tarsus ~ sex + (1|p|fosternest) + (1|q|dam)) bf_back <- bf(back ~ hatchdate + (1|p|fosternest) + (1|q|dam)) fit <- brm(bf_tarsus + bf_back + set_rescor(TRUE),             data = BTdata, chains = 2, cores = 2) dh_check_brms(fit, resp = "tarsus") brms::pp_check(fit, resp = "tarsus") dh_check_brms(fit, resp = "back") brms::pp_check(fit, resp = "back") }
